result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donnielle E Normington Slay

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Donnielle E Normington Slay in court.  Attorney Jonathan A. LaVoy in court for Donnielle E Normington Slay.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by ADA Samuel Berg.  Called @ 1:39 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for statuses on all files - 21CF614, 22CF255, 22CF256, 22CT224, 22CT317, and 22TR1721. Record by Atty. LaVoy that he has been waiting for global offer from ADA Herrmann, but he was waiting for blood results before he provided one. Atty. received notice today that no blood was ever drawn so is hopeful he will get a global offer. Response by Atty. Berg that he will forward files to ADA Herrmann to prepare global offer. Court sets out about 60 days.
Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant Donnielle E. Normington Slay in Court. Attorney Jonathan A. LaVoy in court. State of Wisconsin in Court by ADA TenHaken. Called @ 3:39 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for initial appearance on 22CT317; 3rd status on 21CF614, and first status on 22CF255, 22CF256, 22CT224, and 22TR1721 tracking criminal matters. Record by Atty. LaVoy as to initial appearance - waives reading and enters not guilty plea on new file. Further record by Atty. LaVoy who is asking for time to reach global agreement on all matters. Court sets out as requested.
Status conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
State's Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
records.descr: Notice of motion and motion for discovery

records.addlTxt: Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Signed bond filed with the court.
Status conference on August 4, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

BOND TOTAL ALL FILES - 21CF614, 22CF225, 22CF256, 22CT224. Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Any prescribed medication to be taken within the limits of the prescription. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH JNH DOB 5/16/76.Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Donnielle E Normington Slay in court.  Attorney Jonathan A. LaVoy in court for Donnielle E Normington Slay.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. Called @ 3:19 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for status as to 21CF614 and initial appearances on new files - 22CF255, 22CF256, and 22CT224. Court addresses Atty. LaVoy as to the new files. Response by Atty. LaVoy who acknowledges receipt of the new complaints and wishes to waive the preliminary hearings as to the new felonies. Court goes over waiver with the Defendant. Atty. LaVoy responds to Court's questions regarding waivers. Court finds waivers to be knowing, voluntary, and intelligent and binds the defendant over for trial. State does not have the Informations prepared, but indicates charges will be the same. Based on State's statement, Atty. LaVoy enters not guilty pleas as to new felonies and asks for status in about 60 days. Court enters not guilty plea as to the CT file and informs the parties that matters will be reassigned and scheduled with the Clerk of assigned Judge. Record by Atty. Herrmann who addresses bond.
Court orders bond in 21CF614 to cover all files with the added condition of No contact with JNH, d.o.b. 5/15/1976
No objection by Atty. LaVoy.
